intro: Fleurya cordata, commonly known as the heartleaf fleurya, is a tropical plant native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves, which are typically glossy and dark green. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are usually white or pale pink, often arranged in clusters. It thrives in humid environments and requires well-drained soil to prevent root rot. Fleurya cordata is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and delicate blooms.
